00022 //
00023 #include "chipstream/FileGenders.h"
00024 //
00025 #include "file/TsvFile/TsvFile.h"
00026 #include "util/Fs.h"
00027 #include "util/Util.h"
00028 //
00029 #include <algorithm>
00030 #include <cctype>
00031 #include <cstring>
00032 #include <map>
00033 #include <string>
00034 #include <vector>
00035 //
00036 
00037 using namespace std;
00038 
00039 FileGenders::FileGenders(const string &genderFile, const vector<string> &celFiles) {
00040   affx::TsvFile tsv;
00041   string gender;
00042   string celFileName;
00043   map<string, affx::Gender> celToGender;
00044   map<string, affx::Gender>::iterator iter;
00045   int (*fp)(int)=std::tolower;
00046 
00047   tsv.open(genderFile);
00048   tsv.bind(0,"gender", &gender, affx::TSV_BIND_REQUIRED);
00049   tsv.bind(0,"cel_files", &celFileName, affx::TSV_BIND_REQUIRED);
00050   while(tsv.nextLevel(0) == affx::TSV_OK) {
00051       affx::Gender typedGender = affx::UnknownGender;
00052       transform(gender.begin(), gender.end(), gender.begin(), fp);
00053       if(gender == "male")
00054         typedGender = affx::Male;
00055       else if(gender == "1")
00056         typedGender = affx::Male;
00057       else if(gender == "female")
00058         typedGender = affx::Female;
00059       else if(gender == "2")
00060         typedGender = affx::Female;
00061       celToGender[Fs::basename(celFileName)] = typedGender;
00062   }
00063   tsv.close();
00064 
00065   m_Genders.resize(celFiles.size());
00066   for(int i = 0; i<celFiles.size(); i++) {
00067       iter = celToGender.find(Fs::basename(celFiles[i]));
00068       if(iter == celToGender.end())
00069           Err::errAbort("Unable to find cel file " + Fs::basename(celFiles[i]) + " in gender file " + ToStr(genderFile));
00070       m_Genders[i] = iter->second;
00071   }
00072 
00073   m_GenderName="user-supplied";
00074   m_GenderDescription="user supplied genders";
00075 }
